items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details:
By law the Board of Trustees is required to place a notice in the local newspaper that the District will be presenting a budget to the Board of Trustees for adoption at its September 13, 2011 meeting and that the public may comment on the budget.  Notice was posted in the San Jose Mercury News on Saturday, August 27, 2011, and the budget was made available to the public for inspection Tuesday, September 6, 2011.
	 
This item is intended to identify the place in the agenda where the public may comment on the proposed adopted budget.

items.item_details:
Per the collective bargaining agreement between the Faculty Association AFT 157 and San Jose/Evergreen Community College District Article 9.20 submission and recommendation: 
Article 9.20 ASSIGNMENT LENGTH AND MAXIMUM LOADING - Adjunct faculty members shall be responsible and accountable for all Districts assigned service during the college semester for which they are employed. Assignments are limited to a maximum of 67% of a full load.  
Therefore, the attached information is in compliance with Article 9.20 of the Faculty Association AFT 6157 Collective Bargaining Agreement with San Jose/Evergreen Community College District.
	 
Per the collective bargaining agreement between the Faculty Association AFT 6157 and San Jose/Evergreen Community College District  Article 15.2.1 submission and recommendation:
	 
Article 15.2.1 Full-time unit members' overload assignment  for compensation and/or overload banking shall be based on a separate contract which shall normally be limited to 6 (six) units or 40% of a full load. Exceptions to this maximum overload shall be negotiated with the Faculty Association.
Therefore, the attached information is in compliance with Article 15.2.1 of the Faculty Association AFT 6157 Collective Bargaining Agreement with San Jose/Evergreen Community College District.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the faculty personnel action as submitted.

items.item_details:
A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the following Classified Personnel Actions:
	 
1. Change of Status
	 
a. Hire
Employee hired as the successful candidate for Staff Accountant (8BUSS0207C) in Administrative Services at Evergreen Valley College effective 09/06/11.
	 
b. Re-Employment
Employee re-employed per the CSEA Chapter 363 CBA Article 22.21 "If the District reemploys a unit member as a permanent unit member under the provisions of this section, it shall disregard the break in service of the unit member and classify him/her as, and restore him/her to all the rights, benefits, and burdens of a permanent unit member in the class to which he/she is reinstated."
	 
c. Professional Growth
Professional Growth payment award per the CSEA Chapter 363 CBA Article 20.4.1 "All permanent bargaining unit members shall be eligible for professional growth payments on a prorated basis based on their annual work schedule..."  and article 20.4.4 "Professional Growth will be paid at $75.00 per unit.  These units should be submitted to Human Resources.  Once approved, payments shall be made in a lump-sum (stipend) once a year for the next five years."
	 
2. Separation
	 
a. Resignation
Employee resignation.
	 
b. 39 Month Re-Employment List
Placing employee on the 39-Month Re-Employment list in accordance with CSEA CBA Chapter 363
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Classified personnel Actions as submitted.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Short-Term Hourly, Substitute, Professional Expert & Athletic Support Services, Student Assistant and Volunteer personnel actions as submitted.

items.item_details:
Education Code 81655 stipulates that no contract is an enforceable obligation of the District until it has been approved by the Board of Trustees. District Policy adopted on April 10, 2007 establishes the authority of certain administrators to approve contracts under the bid limit prior to formal Board approval. All contracts and purchase orders exceeding the bid limit (current bid limit is $78,900) should have prior Board approval as a separate board item.
	 
This consent item presents for Board approval: all purchase orders for this period, which includes the purchase orders for administratively approved contracts exceeding $750, as well as additional contracts that, although are not executed by way of purchase order, are deemed appropriate to be added by the Purchasing Department.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees ratify the contracts and purchase orders for the period of July 10, 2011 through August 9, 2011 as noted in the attached documents.

items.item_details:
Board Policy 7080.203 defines Class III records as including, but not limited to, detailed records relating to:  records basic to an audit, including those relating to attendance, average daily attendance, or a business or financial transaction (purchase orders, invoices, warrants, ledger sheets, canceled checks and stubs, student body and cafeteria fund records, etc.), and detailed records used in the preparation of any other report.
	 
Board Policy 7080.204 states that Class III records basic to an audit shall not be destroyed until after the third July 1st succeeding the completion of the audit required by Education Code 84040 or of any other legally required audit, or after the ending date of any retention period by an agency other than the State of California, whichever date is later.
	 
Fiscal Services has the following Class III records that meet the three-year criteria for destruction:
	 
Petty Cash Reimbursements from Fiscal Year 2005-2006
Employee Reimbursements from Fiscal Year 2005-2006
Cash / Bank Reconciliations from Fiscal Year 2005-2006
Canceled Checks / Stubs from Fiscal Year 2005-2006
Paid Invoices from Fiscal Year 2005-2006
Refund Requests from Fiscal Year 2005-2006
Budget Reports from Fiscal Year 2005-2006
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the destruction of records as listed per Section 7080.302 of the Retention and Destruction of Records under Board Policies.

items.item_details: The funds provided through this project will be utilized to provide support to improve student retention, program completion, and success on the National Council Licensure Exam (NCLEX).  This is Year 2 of a two-year grant for the period effective July 1, 2011 - June 30, 2012.

items.item_details:
The Entrepreneurship Career Pathways Project grant from the California Community Colleges, Economic and Workforce Development Career Technical Education Division, disseminates funds to community colleges to implement the Faculty Entrepreneurship Mini-Grant Awards Program by compensating faculty and the college for the creation of courses and programs and related activities that will advance Entrepreneurship and Career Technical Education Programs.  Evergreen Valley College’s application was approved and grant funds awarded in the amount of $15,000.
	 
Rancho Santiago Community College District is acting as the fiscal agent. The sub-grant agreement will allow Evergreen Valley College to receive grant funds not to exceed $15,000 for the period effective July 25, 2011 through June 15, 2012.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the grant sub-agreement between Rancho Santiago Community College District and Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Approval of Grant Sub-Agreement with Rancho Santiago Community College District
items.item_text_raw: 12. Approval of Grant Sub-Agreement with Rancho Santiago Community College District

items.item_details: The District has retained Thomas Griffin Law Offices to assist in adjusting trustee areas as a result of the 2010 Census.  The Thomas Griffin Law Offices will report on existing conditions to demonstrate “over” or “under” representation as compared to the “ideal” trustee area of equal populations to the Board in an open session and solicit suggestions from the Board and the public.  After at least two public hearings at the Board meetings, it is anticipated that the final map will be adopted by the Board by December 2011.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve a consulting contract with The Thomas Griffin Law Offices in the amount of $17,500.00 to assist in adjusting trustee areas as a result of the 2010 Census.

items.item_details:
On February 14, 2006, the Board of Trustees authorized the District to enter into a Construction Careers Agreement (Project  Stabilization Agreement) with the Santa Clara San Benito Building and Trades Council for the Measure G-2004 Bond Program. The benefits derived from this agreement have included increased quality of contractors, increased bidding pools, no labor disputes or work stoppages and increased career opportunities for SJECCD students in the construction industry.
Following the successful passage of Measure G-2010 in November 2010, the District and the Building Trades Council would like to amend the existing agreement to include Measure G 2010. Amendment #1 to the Agreement includes language that expands the scope of the agreement to include Measure G-2010 and amends the process by which the Building and Trades Council resolves jurisdictional disputes.
	 
The Vice-Chancellor, Administrative Services and GilbaneCo. project management staff have reviewed this amendment and recommend approval.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees authorize Amendment #1 to the existing Construction Careers Agreement (Project Stabilization Agreement) between the District and the Santa Clara San Benito Building Trades Council.
items.item_text: Amendment to Construction Careers Agreement (Project Stabilization Agreement) to include Measure G-2010
items.item_text_raw: 4. Amendment to Construction Careers Agreement (Project Stabilization Agreement) to include Measure G-2010

items.item_details:
The Multidisciplinary & Arts Building is a design-build project, currently in construction, with a gross maximum price (GPM) established by the Board of Trustees in the amount of $26,671,663.  The contract requires any savings on the project to be split 50/50 between the design builder, Blach Construction, and the District. At this time there are $975,815 of savings contained within the project in addition to the contingency of $969,767.
	 
Within the original scope of the project, utility connections from the building extended only 15".  A separate project had been defined within Measure G-2010 to bring the other side of the utility connection from the central plant.  However, it is more efficient to add the scope of the central plant connection to this project at a cost of $243,851.  
	 
The college would also like to make some minor changes to convert what was designed as a tutoring center, into a general purpose classroom.  The cost of this change is $2,550.
	 
Both changes in contract scope would be offset by project savings; there is no additional cost associated with this change order.  After this change order, project savings is $729,414.
	 
The Vice-Chancellor, Administrative Services, SJCC President and Construction Manager have reviewed the costs submitted for these changes and recommend approval.
	 
Revised Contract Amount
$26,890,561
				 
Change Order 2 - Scope Change Only
                 0
				 
Revised Contract Amount
$26,890,561
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order #2 as a change in contract scope with Blach Construction, Design-Builder for the Multidisciplinary and Arts Building project at San Jose City College.
items.item_text: Change Order #2 - Multidisciplinary & Arts Building, SJCC

items.item_details:
The Utilities Infrastructure project at EVC is currently in construction. Construction is also about to begin for the Photovoltaic (PV) Array project at  EVC.  It is cost effective to add the conduit to the existing infrastructure project for the future connection of the PV Array.  This prevents double digging in the same spot on campus and is less expensive than a change order to the PV project.   Salas O'Brien, Inc. is the designer for the Utilities Infrastructure project and they have submitted an Add Services Authorization (ASA) in the amount of $3,300 for design, details and construction documents required for the PV Array connection.
	 
	 
Original Contract Amount (inc. reimbursables)
         $207,150
Change in Contract Value for ASA #1
             $3,300
Revised Contract Value
         $210,450
	 
The Vice-Chancellor, Administrative Services and GilbaneCo. construction manager have reviewed the cost submitted for this authorization and recommend approval.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve ASA #1, as a change in contract scope with Salas O'Brien Engineers, Inc. for the Utilities Infrastructure project at EVC.
items.item_text: Additional Service Authorization #1 - Evergreen Valley College (EVC) Utilities Infrastructure Project

items.item_details: Chancellor Cepeda and Vice Chancellor Hawk will provide a budget update.
Chancellor Cepeda will provide a legislative update.

At the special board meeting of August 23, 2011, the Board reviewed topics that were included in the Board Self Evaluation survey and focused on those topics needed to respond to the Shared Recommendations portion of the 2010 Accreditation report, such as the Board's Role, Finances, Planning, Chancellor Relations, Policy, Ethics and Communication Strategies. At a follow up special meeting on Saturday, September 10, 2011, the Board continued its review of additional topics, including Mission and Values, Community Engagement and Advocacy, Knowledge of Programs and Issues, and Institutional Effectiveness, as well as Financial and Ethics topics that were not associated with the Accreditation findings. After completing its review, the Board engaged in an exercise to determine its priorities. The Board Committee on Self Evaluation will provide a report of the Board's actions at both meetings and will also announce the Board's priorities in completing its work plan.

The District’s Measure G-2010 Minority-Owned, Women-Owned and Small Business Program reaffirms the District’s commitment to increase the opportunities for and participation of small and disadvantaged businesses in its procurement of goods and services related to projects in the San Jose Evergreen Community College District Measure G-2010 Bond Program. The District recognizes the importance of supplier diversity and by creating sound business relationships, seeks to strengthen the economic development and viability for minority/women businesses. Through value-added strategic initiatives, the District expects increased competition and additional opportunities. The Minority-Owned, Women-Owned and Small Business Program will institute a variety of initiatives to identify and encourage small and disadvantaged businesses to participate in the District's procurement/bidding process in an effort to ensure continued growth of business opportunities for those business enterprises.
 
This program performs a key role by providing outreach, training, and educational programs. The Minority-Owned, Women-Owned and Small Business Program forms a connecting link between the District and the local small business community. Highlights of the plan include 1) community outreach and education, 2)  partnering with appropriate groups, 3) one-on-ones with small and disadvantaged firms, 4) targeted advertising, and 5) business seminars that teach small business owners how to participate in the public procurement process.  Skills obtained by small businesses through this program can also be used to compete for contracts outside of the Measure G-2010 program.
	 
This service will be provided to the District by Gilbane at no additional cost to the District.  Sunnie Singh, an Evergreen resident and newest member of the SJECCD and Gilbane team, will be the program coordinator.  Attached please find the complete details of the program for your review.
